title: List of heads of state of Sudan - Wikipedia
snippet: Al-Bashir served as head of state, under the title of Chairman of the Revolutionary Command Council for National Salvation from 1989 to 1993 and as president from 1993 to 2019 (and from 1996 as the leader of the National Congress Party).

title: Abdel Fattah al-Burhan - Wikipedia
snippet: It was reported that Sudan wanted Israeli support following the capture of Khartoum by the SAF in exchange for Sudan's recognition. On 6 March 2024, al-Burhan's son, Mohammed Fattah Burhan Rahman, was severely injured after his motorcycle collided with another vehicle in Ankara, Turkey. He died of his injuries on 3 May after spending nearly two months in intensive care. ... ^ While al-Burhan heads the Transitional Sovereignty Council, his role in the council is weak and thus, al-Burhan and the council both served as collective head of state until a coup led by al-Burhan in October 2021 where the council was dissolved and al-Burhan became the sole head of state.

title: List of Heads of State of Sudan
